result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard M Depalma Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard M Depalma Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard M Depalma Jr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:22 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Statement by Court - quashes the warrant.  Statement by defendant - can pay with the next couple of checks, and can pay $30 per month.  Court orders defendant to pay $30 the end of August or do community service at a rate of $7.50 per hour.  If unable to do that, defendant to call the ClerK of Courts with a reasonable explanation and if he does not do that, the warrant will be issued and defendant will be committed to tje Green Lake County Jail for the balance of the monies owed at a rate of $60 per day until paid in full.

Court adjourned at 1:24 P.M.

Court authorizes Warrant - stayed, pending compliance with payment arrangements.

Judgment of Conviction sent to the defendant has been returned.  Return to sender.  Not Deliverable as addressed.  Unable to Forward.

1:25 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes the warrant that was issued yesterday.  Statement by Atty Roeth - has an agreement and matter can be resolved, understands the State did not have time to do victim notification, but victim is present in court.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court recites agreement - will plea to amended count 1 of Disorderly Conduct.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended count 1 and orders count 2 be dismissed outright.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 1:33 p.m.

10:22 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - spoke with the defendant, defendant was going to take the new offer from the District Attorney.  Court orders a warrant stayed to the end of tomorrow (03/14).

Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m.
